meanings.definition: To make thoroughly wet or saturated.
meanings.sent1: After the rainstorm, the kids soakened themselves in the puddles.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally soakened her clothes while doing the dishes.
meanings.sent3: The puppy soakened the floor with muddy paw prints after playing outside.
meanings.sent4: The sponge soakened up all the spilled juice from the table.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rain soakened the soil, making it perfect for planting seeds.

meanings.definition: To become thoroughly wet or saturated.
meanings.sent1: The towel soakened quickly when placed under the dripping faucet.
meanings.sent2: His shoes soakened through after walking in the rain for hours.
meanings.sent3: The sponge soakened up the spilled milk in record time.
meanings.sent4: The river soakened the edges of the campsite, forcing the campers to move their tents.
meanings.sent5: The fabric soakened with water, causing it to stretch and lose its shape.
